title: DSType releases Dobra Slab and Finura
content:
DSType introduces some of the latest releases. Comments welcome!

**Dobra Slab**  
Dobra Slab is robust serif companion to Dobra and it's available in 5 weights with matching italics. Soon available for licensing.  
 [http://www.dstype.com/index.php?id=63](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818172144/http:/www.dstype.com/index.php?id=63 "http://www.dstype.com/index.php?id=63")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818172144im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DobraSlab_5736.gif)

**Finura**  
I don't even know how to describe it. I designed it by impulse and I wonder how it's going to be used! Soon available for licensing.  
 [http://www.dstype.com/index.php?id=61](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818172144/http:/www.dstype.com/index.php?id=61 "http://www.dstype.com/index.php?id=61")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818172144im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Finura_6590.gif)
author: dstype

comments.content: What a beauty ... Finura ... I like it! With a strange ”a” which definetly refuse to collaborate ;-) I think we are going to see this font in magazines or on packaging.
More great work Dino, look forward to adding them to our DSType collection on [www.type.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818172144/http:/www.type.co.uk/ "www.type.co.uk")

Thanks to all of you. Glad you liked it.  
This has been a very busy year, so there is much more to come.

I will now start to design Grossura, that is the opposite of Finura, a very heavy, high contrast typeface, based on the same master.  
I will keep you guys posted.

Best,  
Dino dos Santos  
DSType
I am looking forward to seeing Finura in use! Bringing all those ideas into one typeface and having it look so elegant and refined is quite an accomplishment.
